intro: Pyrenacantha longirostrata, commonly known as the long-beaked pyrenacantha, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, elongated, berry-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a notable species in its native habitat, though it is relatively rare and not widely cultivated.
